rComments: The finest man to grace the uOttawa campus.

Professor Sparling is great. Made political thought lectures fun! He was responsive, respectful&knowledgeable! Amount of readings required was unrealistic! As a student there is no way you can have enough time to properly do all the readings especially if you are taking other classes with it. TAs grading was inconsistent with lectures discussions
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures ', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Prof. Sparling changed me for a better version of myself. I was very fortunate to have him as my professor for this course because I finally know what should I do to write a decent philosophical essay. (The paraphrasing part of the essay workshop is very important for getting a good grade!)

Maybe the best professor I've had. Sparling's lectures are incredibly engaging, he welcomes discussion and dissent and encourages students to think for themselves. Political thought can be dry at times, but Sparling makes it fun. HIGHLY recommend.

I hate philosophy, especially political philosophy, but Professor Sparling made it so interesting I actually really, really enjoyed the class and the material. The assignments were a lot and grading was definitely tough, but if you're willing to put in the work, he is definitely the professor you want for this class to leave with more understanding

You just have to do the readings and actually study. It's nothing out of the ordinary. He doesn't post lectures so you have to go to class. He's super nice though, good at answering questions and clarifying concepts, and he's been my most helpful prof during this pandemic. I recommend
Professor Sparling is an amazing prof, and truly cares about his students success! His lectures are engaging and hes super interesting and funny. Highly recommend!

Truly the best Political Thought professor I have ever had. He is self-defined as someone who does not give A+ which is frustrating when you work very hard but it was a worthwhile learning experience.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures ', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Prof Sparling is definitely the best prof I've had in a POL class. He is engaging and encourages participation without letting discussion railroad the class. He is very respectful and kind, answers questions without condescension, and is super available and helpful outside of class. Lots of reading, but sparknotes is enough for some of the texts.
Subject is hard to grasp, but he does a good job at explaining political theory. He's also funny, which makes the class a bit easier to get through

A great professor but more importantly a great person. He is firm, and makes you work for an A (as all professors should), but is not unduly harsh. He values justice and merit, but leaves room for compassion in his teaching. I will remember him for a long time for his passion and style. Recommend.
A great prof with a greater attitude. Is available to meet after class or by email and gives helpful advice. Lots of reading but his discussion make it worth it.
By far one of the best professors at the university! So easy to talk to, and he really wants to make sure you do well in his course, would 10/10 recommend to a friend.
A really great prof, makes the class really fun

Professor Sparling is one of my favourite professors in the Political Science department. I've taken 2 classes with him so far, and both turned out to be super interesting because of his energy and teaching methods. He is caring about his students and available outside of class. Highly recommend!
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures ']

rComments: This professor is incredibly knowledgeable, engaging, and truly passionate about his field. He treats his students with respect and thoughtfully engages with all of their readings of the text, even if they contradict his own. You will need to put the work in and read the texts to do well, but his exam formats allow you to focus on your strengths.

Consider yourself blessed if you have this professor. Brilliant lecturer, knowledgeable, kind, great human being; he's the whole package. Your vocabulary will become richer just by listening to him. Having said sad, get ready to read -at lot. You won't do well in exams, the DGD and the essay unless you red the books studied in the class.
Super nice prof and hilarious in a really subtle way. The class isn't an easy A, but it's not impossible to get one either. Just read the texts, show up and ask questions if you don't understand.
real chill dude
Great class, great guy!
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: I honestly had no interest in political thought but he definitely makes it interesting and easy to engage with. Exams q's given ahead of time, paper was decent although marking was a bit difficult. Take good notes and things will make sense, if you're not interested in the material subject-wise.
amazing professor!

Professor Sparling gives very fun lectures and does an amazing job at explaining the content of the course in a way which is easy to digest. He is very understanding, and helpful. He is incredibly passionate about the subjects he lectures on, and that passion is contagious. I learnt a lot in this class!

Best POL prof at uOttawa-passionate, brilliant, engaging and truly cares about his students. Wonderful lecturer, marking isn't easy but fair , he  and actually gives you time to prepare and reflex on the subject matter by providing essay questions ahead of time. A lot but reading but pieces are worth a read. I strongly recommend this prof!

If you take diligent notes in his class, everything will make sense at the end of the semester. He e-mails exam questions in advance, so there should be surprises on the exam (if you prepared, that is).

Decent lecturer, would convey the subject matter more effectively with consistent visuals like power-point etc. Very helpful for the examinations and they were not to tricky. The marking was fair, and the paper was not too bad along with fair marking as well. All in all, for a mandatory class, not bad.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Participation matters', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Great Prof! Nice, engaging and open-minded. Although, I  had no particular interest in political theory, I attended all his classes and found them quite interesting.

Obviously very interested in his subject matter, and expresses these feelings to the class. He is clear and direct in his analysis of class texts, and humerous when the class becomes more philosophical and hard to follow. Overall, a great class.
Wonderful lecturer, eloquent and entertaining. Makes a 3hours lecture fly by and has the ability to engage his students. Would strongly recommend!

Seems nervous and stutters quite a bit (enough to notice, but not enough to drive focus away). Interesting lectures, and very funny side comments! The only thing is I wish he had powerpoints or online notes. Would recommend!
Great Prof! Hilarious and engaging!

An extremely intelligent, friendly, and approachable prof. Lectures are very interesting and his side comments ARE quite funny. I made a point not to miss any classes. Will definitely try to get him again.

Being in his class is definitely an experience. He has very reasonable expectations, interesting material and REALLY funny side comments. He makes going to office hours well worth it and intellectually and gently "shuts down" all the presumptuous students who ask questions just to make themselves seem smarter.
Great class, great prof. Responds to emails quickly and is always available if you dont understand part of the lecture material. Fun to listen to!
Good looking. Sometimes talks too long and went overtime. Overall good prof.
